courseDescription:
You will learn how to build a JavaScript interactive timeline from scratch. This course teaches you the basic steps for creating a dynamic, interactive single web page. You will learn how to open an index.html page on which the code is written from the editor. The dynamic timeline is built on a single web page. See how to design the web page structure, and create and name files where some of the page content or data are saved. You will also understand the interaction between the HTML page and the web page. Most basically, you will get familiar with the arrangement of the variables and operators during coding. The material explains how to create random content data. Coding is about creating functions that are expected to be seen on the web page so you will learn how to create functions and output content to the page. You will also learn how to create functions that will sort content and indicate a list of events within the page.

This course explains the fundamental relationship between the console and the information put out on the web page. Master how to style and position content. You will also be able to create interaction with JavaScript, styling, page positioning, and content arrangements. Learn how to hide content or show it when such a command is given on the page, which can be done using the opacity function. JavaScript coding always has the allowance to make adjustments or corrections anytime.

This course helps you to create an outstanding interactive timeline for your website users and gives you a soft landing in mastering the skills needed to build a dynamic timeline using JavaScript object notation (JSON).
